{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3574102,"name":null,"username":"meepleBot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T20:34:32.279Z","cooked":"

We are having an issue where our LL 3G is not connecting properly to our robot during tournaments. It has happened two weekends in a row. It will eventually connect, but it may not be until near the end of the match. We have replaced the LL, replaced the radio, replaced the ethernet cable, rewired the LL to go from using a VRM straight to PDP (I know suggested is VRM, but we were throwing everything at it we could think of), made sure firmware is upgraded. It does not seem to be related to how long the robot is turned on as we were wondering if the 3G was just taking a long time to connect. Here is a screenshot from one of our logs from this weekend. At time 127 is when our auto starts. At time 258 is when it finally starts to transmit data. Any ideas on what else we can try? (filtering out everything but the LL connection info)

The LL is connected straight to one of the radio Aux ports

LLTimeout2218×667 270 KB

How much bandwidth are you using?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T21:50:59.847Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":66,"readers_count":65,"score":18.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497442,"topic_slug":"limelight-connection-issue","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-connection-issue/497442/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3574174,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T21:58:35.849Z","cooked":"

The approximate minute gap is about how long the LL takes to boot up from power off. You’ve replaced everything - every Ethernet and power wire, LL, connector back to the PDP (promise you replaced everything?).

Was the VRM that you removed on the same PDP port as when you were directly to the PDP? If so, that PDP port would be the first device in common with all your problems.

The next easiest test - replace the circuit breaker.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T22:03:27.483Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":10.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497442,"topic_slug":"limelight-connection-issue","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-connection-issue/497442/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3574191,"name":"","username":"SirFire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sirfire/{size}/222590_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T22:19:38.747Z","cooked":"

Not sure if this is the issue or not, but we had a very similar issue at our regional last weekend. With the driver station laptop connected to the robot, and the limelight disconnected, we pinged the limelight’s IP address and somehow it was sending back a reply, so something on the computer was using the same IP address as the limelight. No idea how it happened or if it’s relevant to this but I figured I’d throw it out there. We ended up disabling the Wifi connection adapter on the laptop which let us access the limelight, then we changed the static IP address. Good luck!

I don’t have that info in front of me, but we only have the one LL that was publishing to NT. Not using it for a stream. We do not have a driver camera.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T23:03:05.356Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":8.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497442,"topic_slug":"limelight-connection-issue","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":65,"username":"Joe_Ross","name":"Joe Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51325,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-connection-issue/497442/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3574301,"name":null,"username":"meepleBot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T23:04:58.192Z","cooked":"

The only thing we did not replace was the physical wire between the LL and the power. But we powered it up and pretty violently shook that wire to see if there was a disconnect, which it did not. I don’t know if the VRM was on the same PDP port as when we directly wired. I’d have to ask the student who made the change, but that is a good thing to check.

I’ll check the students to see if it was disabled or not. The weird thing is that it only happened sporadically. We would have five matches connected, then a match where it connected, then two where it connected… so no discernable pattern.

If the LL is running hot, could this be part of the problem? We currently don’t have any heat dissipation on it, but we did not need it last year and was fine.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T23:08:02.853Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":36,"readers_count":35,"score":12.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497442,"topic_slug":"limelight-connection-issue","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51325,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-connection-issue/497442/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3574345,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T23:44:57.511Z","cooked":"

LL3G is built to withstand heat, The case is made out of carbon and acts like a “heatsink” if I’m not mistaken, nevertheless it still needs to have good airflow around the camera so if you have an enclosure that prevents air from reaching the camera, consider replacing it with one that has ventilation holes, But I don’t think that is the reason it’s turning off unless the camera gets VERY hot.

Ours runs about 65 C and the fan goes on fast and slow on fairly long cycles. You can see the temp on the dashboard.

I’m pretty sure the temp was below that. They started monitoring during matches with the LL page open.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-31T01:40:54.093Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":28,"readers_count":27,"score":5.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497442,"topic_slug":"limelight-connection-issue","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51325,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-connection-issue/497442/13","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3575177,"name":null,"username":"meepleBot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T17:38:50.461Z","cooked":"

Looking further into the logs, I do think it is a temperature issue. If the LL is about 36 Celsius or below when the robot is turned on, the camera stream to the LL webpage connects within about 6 seconds. If the temp of the LL is 40 Celsius or above, it will connect and let us set the filtered April Tags. However, it will take the camera stream between 219 and 254 seconds to connect. We have our LL mounted the same as last year on a 3d printed mount. But it seems it gets hotter this year, so we are going to try adding some heat sinks and see if that fixes the problem.
